title: Liverpool's Jürgen Klopp brushes off winning-streak hype after late victory over Leicester – video
text:
Jürgen Klopp saluted his players' attitude after James Milner's injury-time penalty secured a 2-1 win against Leicester City and extended a club-record hot streak to 17 Premier League matches.

'So far, so good, but 30 games to come,' Klopp said. 'So we are not fussed really by the situation, that people talk to us about the winning streak.'

Meanwhile, Foxes manager Brendan Rodgers said: "To concede a 95th-minute penalty was obviously difficult to take, because I thought we deserved a point from the game."
description: Jürgen Klopp saluted his players' attitude after James Milner's injury-time penalty secured a 2-1 win against Leicester City and extended a club-record hot streak to 17 Premier League matches
